page.title: 02Village School Headteacher
page.content: Most of the headteacher's time is spent on teaching. If he was working as headteacher in a town school, time would be used in other ways. In a village school though the headteacher has to do all that kind of work in his spare time. The headteacher doesn't think he gets paid enough and would go on strike if his union asked him to. He says that the children in town schools tend to fight more than in village schools and that children in the country are more friendly towards each other. The crazes are the same. His worries are on a much wider scale than a normal teacher but he has the power to improve the school and to change something he doesn't like.
